meanings.definition: To start or develop a business without external help or capital.
meanings.sent1: She bootstrapped her bakery by using her own savings.
meanings.sent2: The entrepreneur bootstrapped her startup company from scratch.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he bootstrapped his lemonade stand with just a dollar and a dream.
meanings.sent4: The small business was bootstrapped into success through sheer determination.
meanings.sent5: Bootstrapping a business requires hard work and perseverance.

meanings.definition: To improve or develop something using existing resources or capabilities.
meanings.sent1: The team bootstrapped their project by repurposing old materials.
meanings.sent2: She bootstrapped her resume by highlighting her relevant skills.
meanings.sent3: He humorously claimed he bootstrapped his cooking skills by watching YouTube videos.
meanings.sent4: The artist bootstrapped her creativity by exploring different mediums.
meanings.sent5: Bootstrapping a project can lead to innovative solutions.
